business.headline: Maximising returns: How to select top mutual funds for your portfolioMutual funds have emerged as a popular investment option, offering a balanced approach to growing wealth without the complexity of managing individual stocks.

'Multiple call recordings exist': Byju's cries foul after auditor BDO resignsIn a strong response to BDO's resignation, Byju's has accused the audit firm of making unethical requests and manipulating the audit process, including suggesting the backdating of financial reports.

Byju's crisis worsens as second auditor BDO resigns over financial concernsBDO's exit comes just a year after Deloitte, the company's previous auditor, stepped down citing problems with Byju's financial reporting.
Payment aggregators may face 18% GST for transactions up to Rs 2,000: ReportThe final decision will be made at the GST Council's 54th meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

US adds 1,42,000 jobs in August; unemployment rate drops to 4.2%While the job data fell short of expectations, a slight dip in the unemployment rate to 4.2% indicated that the labour market is gradually cooling off, but not dramatically.

IPO investors are not looking beyond listing gains, are they missing out?According to a Sebi study, 70% of the shares, by value, were sold within a year of the IPO. The quick turnover is particularly noticeable in cases where IPO shares see a strong rise in value right after listing.

Anant Ambani donates 20 kg gold crown worth Rs 15 crore to Lalbaugcha RajaLalbaugcha Raja, Mumbai's most popular Ganesh idol, was unveiled on Thursday ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi. Devotees visit the Lalbaugcha Raja for darshan during the 10-day Ganesh festival.

Explained: Why Godfrey Phillips shares hit record high despite market downturnAt the closing bell, the shares of Godfrey Phillips were up 12.69% at Rs 7,204.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, the stock jumped 14.50% to reach a record high of Rs 7,320, defying a sharp correction in the domestic indices.

Tata Motors shares decline for 6th straight day. Is it a good time to buy?Tata Motors stock settled over 1.8% lower on Friday, extending losses for the sixth consecutive session. Read on to know whether it is the right time to buy the stock.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, Nifty slips under 24,900 on US data jittersThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 1017.23 points to close at 81,183.93, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 292.95 points lower to end at 24,852.15.
Godfrey Phillips set to consider 2:1 bonus issue; shares jump over 9%A bonus issue is a way for companies to reward existing shareholders without making them pay for the additional shares.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 5 lakh croreThe bloodbath on Dalal Street has wiped off nearly Rs 5 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Government may slash petrol, diesel prices as global crude oil rates fallUS crude oil prices dropped by more than 1% on Wednesday, falling below $70 per barrel. Brent crude prices followed suit, falling by $1 to reach $72.75 per barrel.
Bina Modi to vote on behalf of family trust at Godfrey Phillips AGMThe Delhi High Court recently allowed Bina to cast her vote on behalf of the trust, which holds a 47.5% stake in the company.

Goldman Sachs gives SBI 'sell' rating with revised target price. Know whyThe brokerage highlighted a growing risk-reward imbalance for SBI's stock, driven by challenges in maintaining a strong return on assets.

India's household food spending dips to less than 50%: ReportThe change in spending, highlighted in a recent report by the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), signals a shift in how Indian families allocate their monthly budgets.
Sensex, Nifty down 1%: What's behind today's stock market turbulence?Today's market turbulence is partly linked to investor jitters ahead of the US non-farm payrolls report expected later today.
Explained: Why Vodafone Idea shares tumbled over 14% today As of 11:51 am, Vodafone Idea's shares were trading at Rs13.60, down nearly 10%.
Boss Packaging Solutions makes debut on NSE SME at 25% premiumBoss Packaging Solutions listing: The stock was listed at Rs 82.5 on the NSE SME, marking a 25% premium over its IPO price of Rs 66.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Pakistan army admits role in Kargil War for first time: 'Several soldiers...'Pakistan army chief General Asim Munir said several soldiers had laid down their lives while fighting various wars with India, including the one in Kargil in 1999.

Manipur on the boil again: Rocket attacks, drone use escalate violenceOver the past few days, Manipur has witnessed a resurgence of violence in several districts of the state. Chief Minister N Biren Singh chaired a meeting over the law and order situation in the state.

Centre discharges Puja Khedkar from IAS with immediate effectIn an official order on Friday, former trainee IAS officer Puja Khedkar, accused of misusing OBC and disability quota benefits in the civil service exams, was discharged from the service with immediate effect.

5 killed, many feared trapped after 3-storey building collapses in LucknowFive bodies were recovered, and 28 people were rescued from the debris after a three-storey building collapsed in the Transport Nagar area in Lucknow.

In pictures: Vibrant glimpse of Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations across IndiaGanesh Chaturthi was celebrated with great fervour across the country on Saturday. Large idols of Lord Ganesh were established on numerous temporary stages set up for this occasion across the country.

Postpone exams, free karsevaks: Many motives behind Indian plane hijackingsIndia witnessed a spate of plane hijackings from the 70s to the 90s that saw unique demands by hijackers. While some had political motives, like the freeing of Indira Gandhi from jail, others had to do with a range of issues, from the construction of a Ram Mandir in Ayodhya to postponing of exams. IC 814 was one of the 16 hijackings of an Indian plane.

4 test positive for drugs after raids at five pubs in HyderabadThe raids at five pubs in Hyderabad, led by Excise Enforcement Director VB Kamalasan Reddy, resulted in four individuals testing positive for consuming drugs out of the 33 tested.

Homeless man hit by car, dragged for 10 metres in Delhi, dies; driver arrested The incident took place on Wednesday, when the homeless man, Lekhraj, 45, was hit by the car driven by Shivam Dubey, 28, near Barakhamba Radial Road. Dubey allegedly drove the car for around 10 metres with Lekhraj stuck under the car.

Gone in 15 seconds: Watch the moment Louisiana skyscraper implodesThe 22-storey Hertz Tower, an abandoned landmark in Louisiana's Lake Charles area, met its dramatic end on Saturday as it was imploded in a controlled demolition.

A viral video of the demolition showed the structure crashing down in mere seconds. The building collapse enveloped the area in a thick cloud of dust, leaving behind a rubble pile roughly five stories high.

The building, formerly known as the Capital One Tower, was badly damaged in hurricanes Laura and Delta. The owners of the building, after making several attempts to repair it, ultimately decided to have it torn down, news agency Associated Press reported.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Kangana Ranaut is right. Did celestial bullets kill Indira Gandhi?Kangana Ranaut's film Emergency is in the crosshairs for sticking to facts at a time when Anubhav Sinha's IC 814 is in the eye of the storm for blatant disregard for facts. As Sikh groups protest after watching a 3-minute trailer, here's a pertinent question from Kangana. And a question on freedom of expression vis-a-vis the trust deficit.

US Open: 2024 signals changing of the guard in men's singles tennisThe US Open final on Sunday, September 8, will feature Jannik Sinner, the first Italian man to reach this stage, and Taylor Fritz, the first American man in 18 years to compete in the title match in New York. Remarkably, for the first time since 2002, none of the Big Three -- Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer, or Rafael Nadal has won a Grand Slam title in a calendar year.
Why Goa could be the next WayanadGoa's landscape — characterised by plateaus and steep slopes — is particularly vulnerable to erosion and landslides if its natural features are disturbed.

Auto driver who filmed woman being raped on busy Ujjain road arrestedThe police have recovered the mobile phone from which the video was shot by the accused and have also found the video on the phone.

Bajrang Punia hits back at Brij Bhushan: Gloating over Vinesh Phogat's Olympic lossReacting to Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh's statement that Vinesh Phogat deserved to be disqualified from the Paris Olympics, Bajrang Punia said the ex-WFI chief was gloating over the wrestler's loss, and that those celebrating her loss were not true patriots.

Starliner becomes only spacecraft to launch with crew but return emptyThis unique situation marks a significant moment in space exploration and highlights the challenges faced in developing new spacecraft systems.

Mehbooba Mehbooba to Tauba Tauba: Makers on evolution of item songs'Item songs' or 'item numbers' have been a part of Hindi cinema for ages, and have featured multiple times every decade since the 1950s. In today's edition of Cinematic Saturday, we speak to producers and music artistes to decode their evolution and impact on Bollywood.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

New Aadhaar applicants in Assam must submit NRC application number: Himanta SarmaThe Chief Minister said that applications for Aadhaar cards are more than the population in the state, which indicates that there are doubtful citizens.

Watch Ambanis welcome Ganpati Bappa to their Mumbai homeAs the fervour of the annual Ganeshotsav takes over the country, especially Mumbai, the entire family of billionaire Mukesh Ambani too welcomed Ganpati Bappa to their home with devotion and enthusiasm on the auspicious occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi on Saturday, September 7.

Badshah says cultural differences led to divorce from Jasmine Masih: It got messyBadshah discussed his 2020 divorce from Jasmine Masih, citing cultural adjustment issues. He also shared his views on the institution of marriage and why its fundamentals need to be updated in today's day and age.

Gayatri Devi's days in Emergency: Marriage proposals and sewer rats in TiharThe Princess of Cooch Behar and Maharani of Jaipur, Gayatri Devi, was jailed for five-and-a-half months during the Emergency. She spent those months in Tihar jail with political prisoners, pickpockets, prostitutes, and sewer rats for company.

iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Pro are set to get big camera upgrades, here are the key details The iPhone 16 series is scheduled to launch globally at the Apple Glowtime event on September 9. Ahead of the launch, key details including that about the camera of the smartphones, have leaked. Here is everything we may already know.

Raids lead Enforcement Directorate to RG Kar ex-principal's luxurious bungalowED officials discovered a luxurious bungalow in Bengal's South 24 Parganas linked to former RG Kar Medical College and Hospital principal Dr Sandip Ghosh, as part of an ongoing probe into alleged financial irregularities at the institution.

Kareena Kapoor-Saif Ali Khan, Aamir Khan to Sonam Kapoor: Celebs at Ambani Ganpati celebrationsMukesh Ambani and Nita Ambani celebrated Ganesh Chaturthi at their Mumbai residence on September 7 with utmost grandeur. Many celebrities like Kareena Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan, Aamir Khan and Sonam Kapoor joined the celebrations.

SRK celebrates Ganesh Chaturthi: May the lord bless us with health and joySuperstar Shah Rukh Khan on Saturday, September 7, shared a photo of the Ganesha idol at his place and wished his fans a happy Ganesh Chaturthi.

Brazilian music legend Sergio Mendes, who made bossa nova popular, dies at 83Brazilian music legend Sergio Mendes has died. He was 83. Mendes was known for making bossa nova, a kind of samba, globally popular.

Kiara Advani, Pooja Hegde arrive at Manish Malhotra's house for Ganesh pujaActors such as Kiara Advani, Khushi Kapoor and Pooja Hegde marked their presence at Manish Malhotra's residence to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi.

sports.headline: Sunil Chhetri gifts football with pin-point long-range pass to fan in standsLegendary Indian footballer Sunil Chhetri made a fan's day during Bengaluru FC's training at the Kanteerava Stadium on Saturday, September 7. After the fans requested for the ball high up in the stands, Chhetri obliged with a sensational lofted pass that found the fan.

SCO vs AUS 3rd T20I: All-round Green helps Australia complete 3-0 clean sweepAn all-round performance from Cameron Green ensured that Australia completed a 3-0 clean sweep over Scotland on September 7, Saturday.

Sinner rested for Italy's Davis Cup Finals group stage after US Open heroicsJannik Sinner will not be available for the Italian team for their Davis Cup Finals group stage in September. The World No. 1 has been granted time-off to rest after his US Open heroics.

Paralympics: Telangana rewards Deepthi Jeevanji with Rs 1 crore, plot in WarangalThe Telangana government announced multiple rewards for Paralympics bronze medallist Deepthi Jeevanji on Saturday, September 7. Telangana CM Revanth Reddy announced a cash prize of Rs 1 crore for the intellectually impaired athlete and a 500-sq-yard plot in Warangal.

No stress, more intent: Fritz hopeful of scripting history in US Open finalUS Open 2024: Taylor Fritz will take on World No. 1 Jannik Sinner in his maiden Grand Slam final on Sunday in New York. Fritz is bidding to become the first American man since Andy Roddick in 2003 to win a singles Grand Slam crown.

Watch: Rooney turns back clock with stunning free-kick for Man UnitedManchester United talisman Wayne Rooney scored a stunning freekick during a charity match against Celctic FC on Saturday, September 7. Playing in a legends' game, Rooney turned the clock with a freekick that crashed into the top-corner at the Old Trafford.

Watch: Joe Root stunned as Chris Woakes bowls spin vs Sri LankaEngland seamer Chris Woakes was forced to bowl spin against Sri Lanka on Day 2 of the 3rd Test match. Woakes' action, which was similar to Joe Root, had the latter in splits at The Oval on Saturday, September 7.

Asian Champions Trophy 2024: All you need to know as India look to defend crownIndia will be aiming to start their new era in hockey by defending their Asian Champions Trophy crown in Hulunbuir, China. The tournament for India starts with a matchup against hosts China.

Shreyas Iyer happy with intent-filled fifty despite loss vs India CDuleep Trophy: India batter Shreyas Iyer scored a brisk fifty in the first round of the tournament. Iyer said that he was satisfied with his innings but rued losing their match against Ruturak Gaikwad's India C.

Toni Kroos shares cheeky post on Cristiano Ronaldo's 900 career goalsToni Kroos humorously congratulated Cristiano Ronaldo on his 900th career goal, joking that he's "not even close" to that milestone himself. The tweet highlights their camaraderie from their successful years at Real Madrid.

Joe Root has been something else for a long period of time: Kane WilliamsonSpeaking to reporters ahead of New Zealand's one-off Test against Afghanistan in Greater Noida, Kane Williamson opened up about the Fab Four and expressed his admiration for Joe Root. Williamson said he is looking forward to the challenge of playing six Tests in the subcontinent in the next three months.

Women's Delhi Premier League: North Delhi Strikers reach Final with Riders winThe North Delhi Strikers women advanced to the final of the Women's Delhi Premier League T20 after securing a 7-wicket win over East Delhi Riders Women using the DLS method on Saturday, September 7.

Rishabh Pant, Sarfaraz fireworks help India B edge ahead on Day 3Duleep Trophy 2024: Rishabh Pant and Sarfaraz Khan's quickfire knocks helped India B end Day 3 of the first round match with a lead of 240 runs. Pant entertained the Bengaluru crowd on Saturday with some audacious shots against both pacers and spinners of the India A side.

Andrew Flintoff named head coach of England Lions men's teamFormer England all-rounder Andrew Flintoff has been appointed as the head coach of the England Lions men's team. Flintoff will now oversee the junior programme and work with young cricketers pushing for a place in the national team.

Thought Barcelona time was going to be different: Vitor Roque on time at clubVitor Roque has slammed Barcelona for their treatment of him during his time at the club. Roque, bought in January, was forced to Real Betis on loan during the summer transfer window.

Want to begin Olympic cycle with Asian Champions Trophy win: Harmanpreet SinghIndia captain Harmanpreet Singh wants his side to start the new Olympic cycle by defending their crown at the Asian Champions Trophy 2024. India begin their campaign on September 8 against China.

Watch: Messi shares special message to Suarez on international retirement Luis Suárez's emotional farewell at Centenario Stadium, marked by a heartfelt video message from Lionel Messi, brought tears as Uruguay honoured their legendary striker after 17 years and 69 goals in international football.

Free-flowing Rishabh Pant hits 34-ball fifty on return to first-class cricket Duleep Trophy 2024: Playing only his second first-class knock since recovering from the road accident, Rishabh Pant hit a 34-ball fifty. He led India B's revival in the second innings of the first-round match against India A at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru on Saturday, September 7.

He led India B's revival in the second innings of the first-round match against India A at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru on Saturday, September 7.

Pakistan needs tough coach like Gautam Gambhir after recent run: Danish KaneriaDanish Kaneria feels that Pakistan needs a tough coach like Gautam Gambhir at the helm of things after their poor string of performances and issues off the field. Kaneria feels a strong person like Gambhir is needed to solve the issues.

Ruturaj Gaikwad's India C begin Duleep Trophy with hard-fought win vs India DDuleep Trophy 2024: Ruturaj Gaikwad's India C registered a 4-wicket win over India D. Abhishek Porel's unbeaten 35 took India C home as they chased down the target of 233 runs at the Anantapur on Saturday, September 7.

R Ashwin thrilled with DRS in domestic cricket, mentions major lesson for battersStar India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has hailed BCCI for the use of DRS technology in domestic cricket mentioning a major shift in the batter's technique.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
